thread.title: Coastguard helicopter goes missing off coast of Ireland while rescuing man from fishing boat
thread.title_full: Coastguard helicopter goes missing off coast of Ireland while rescuing man from fishing boat

author: Chris kitching
title: Coastguard helicopter goes missing off coast of Ireland while rescuing man from fishing boat
text:
News One rescued in critical condition as search continues for three others after coastguard helicopter goes missing off Ireland The Dublin-based R116 search and rescue helicopter and its crew disappeared off the west coast overnight in "misty and wet" weather Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Coast Guard helicopter goes missing off coast of Ireland Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A man has been located after an Irish Coast Guard helicopter went missing as it helped to rescue a fisherman from a boat. 
The man's condition is described as critical, and the search for three other men continues. 
The Dublin-based R116 search and rescue helicopter and its crew disappeared off the west coast overnight in "misty and wet" weather. 
Contact with the aircraft, which was providing top cover for another helicopter, was lost around 1am. 
Its last location was Blacksod lighthouse, about 14 nautical miles off the coast of Co Mayo. An Irish Coast Guard helicopter (file photo) (Photo: Reuters) 
A major sea search was launched in an attempt to locate the aircraft. 
The Irish Navy's LE Roisin was en route to join the search effort. 
An Irish Coast Guard spokesperson said: "At approximately 1am contact was lost with one of our SAR Helicopters. 
“A major sea search is ongoing off the county Mayo coast approximately six miles west of Blacksod. 
“SAR Helicopters from Sligo and Shannon are on scene along with the Air Corps Casa. Ballyglass and Achill all weather lifeboats (ALBs) are on scene along with five local fishing vessels.” An Irish Coast Guard helicopter (Photo: Irish Coast guard / Facebook) 
Speaking on RTE, Fergus Sweeney said: “Last location was Blacksod lighthouse which is about 14 nautical miles off the coast. 
“By all accounts it should have been a routine mission. 
“The weather it was quite misty and wet and visibility wouldn’t have been that great.” 
Minister for Transport, Tourism and Sport Shane Ross T.D. expressed deep concern over the helicopter's disappearance. 
He said: "As the search for the Dublin-based helicopter R116 is currently underway I would like to express my sincere support and sympathies for all those involved, particularly those family members who are awaiting news of their loved ones. 
"This is an extremely difficult time for all concerned. As we await further information I would like to appeal for space to be given to the relevant professionals involved in the search operation to complete their work." Like us on Facebook
